intro: Mespilodaphne indecora var. minor, commonly known as the small-flowered mespilodaphne, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring, showcasing a delicate white or pale yellow color. The plant has oval, leathery leaves that are often arranged in pairs along the stem. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
